title: Google\Cloud\Spanner\SpannerClient
name: SpannerClient
description:
Cloud Spanner is a highly scalable, transactional, managed, NewSQL database service. Find more information at Cloud Spanner docs.

In production environments, it is highly recommended that you make use of the Protobuf PHP extension for improved performance. Protobuf can be installed via PECL.

$ pecl install protobuf

examples.caption: Using a Spanner Emulator

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Create a Spanner client. Please note that this client requires the gRPC extension.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration Options.

params.name: config.apiEndpoint
params.description: A hostname with optional port to use in place of the service's default endpoint.

params.name: config.projectId
params.description: The project ID from the Google Developer's Console.

params.name: config.authCache
params.description: A cache for storing access tokens. Defaults to a simple in memory implementation.

params.name: config.authCacheOptions
params.description: Cache configuration options.

params.name: config.authHttpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver Psr7 requests specifically for authentication.

params.name: config.credentialsFetcher
params.description: A credentials fetcher instance.

params.name: config.httpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver Psr7 requests. Only valid for requests sent over REST.

params.name: config.keyFile
params.description: The contents of the service account credentials .json file retrieved from the Google Developer's Console. Ex: json_decode(file_get_contents($path), true).

params.name: config.keyFilePath
params.description: The full path to your service account credentials .json file retrieved from the Google Developers Console.

params.name: config.requestTimeout
params.description: Seconds to wait before timing out the request. Defaults to 0 with REST and 60 with gRPC.

params.name: config.retries
params.description: Number of retries for a failed request. Used only with default backoff strategy. Defaults to 3.

params.name: config.scopes
params.description: Scopes to be used for the request.

params.name: config.quotaProject
params.description: Specifies a user project to bill for access charges associated with the request.

params.name: config.returnInt64AsObject
params.description: If true, 64 bit integers will be returned as a Google\Cloud\Core\Int64 object for 32 bit platform compatibility. Defaults to false.

params.name: config.queryOptions
params.description: Query optimizer configuration.

params.name: config.queryOptions.optimizerVersion
params.description: An option to control the selection of optimizer version. This parameter allows all execute queries to use a specific query optimizer version. Specifying "latest" as a value instructs Cloud Spanner to use the latest supported query optimizer version. query-level values will take precedence over any global settings. If the SPANNER_OPTIMIZER_VERSION environment variable is set, it will take second priority. This value is used when neither a query-level value nor the environment variable is set. Any other positive integer (from the list of supported optimizer versions) overrides the default optimizer version for query execution. Executing a SQL statement with an invalid optimizer version will fail with a syntax error (INVALID_ARGUMENT) status.

params.name: config.useDiscreteBackoffs
params.description: false: use default backoff strategy (retry every failed request up to retries times). true: use discrete backoff settings based on called method name. Defaults to false.

exceptions.description: If the gRPC extension is not enabled.

methods.name: batch
methods.description:
Get a Batch Client.

Batch Clients allow you to execute reads of very large data sets, spread across multiple partitions.

params.name: instanceId
params.description: The instance to connect to.

params.name: databaseId
params.description: The database to connect to.

params.name: baseConfig
params.description: The base configuration to extend for this custom instance configuration.

params.name: name
params.description: The configuration name. Should be prefixed with "custom-".

params.name: replicas
params.description: The replica information for the new instance configuration. This array must contain all the replicas from the base configuration, plus at least one from list of optional replicas of the base configuration. One of the replicas must be set as the default leader location.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.displayName
params.description: Defaults to the value of $name.

params.name: options.leaderOptions
params.description: Allowed values of the "default_leader" schema option for databases in instances that use this instance configuration. Defaults to the leader options of the base configuration. Please note it may be possible for the default value to be an empty array when lazy loading the base configuration. To ensure the default value matches the upstream values please make sure to trigger a network request on the base configuration with either Google\Cloud\Spanner\InstanceConfiguration::reload() or Google\Cloud\Spanner\InstanceConfiguration::info().

params.name: options.labels
params.description: For more information, see Using labels to organize Google Cloud Platform resources.

params.name: options.validateOnly
params.description: An option to validate, but not actually execute, the request, and provide the same response. Defaults to false.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options.

params.name: options.pageSize
params.description: Maximum number of results to return per request.

params.name: options.resultLimit
params.description: Limit the number of results returned in total. Defaults to 0 (return all results).

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: A previously-returned page token used to resume the loading of results from a specific point.

methods.name: instanceConfiguration
methods.description:
Get an instance configuration by its name.

NOTE: This method does not execute a service request and does not verify the existence of the given configuration. Unless you know with certainty that the configuration exists, it is advised that you use Google\Cloud\Spanner\InstanceConfiguration::exists() to verify existence before attempting to use the configuration.

params.name: name
params.description: The Configuration name.

params.name: config
params.description: The configuration details.

methods.name: instanceConfigOperations
methods.description: Lists instance configuration operations for the project.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API response. The API may return fewer values in a page, even if there are additional values to be retrieved.

params.name: options.resultLimit
params.description: Limit the number of results returned in total. Defaults to 0 (return all results).

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: A page token is used to specify a page of values to be returned. If no page token is specified (the default), the first page of values will be returned. Any page token used here must have been generated by a previous call to the API.

params.description: The configuration to use

params.name: options.nodeCount

params.name: options.startType
params.description: Either "open" or "closed". Use constants KeyRange::TYPE_OPEN and KeyRange::TYPE_CLOSED for guaranteed correctness.

params.name: options.start
params.description: The key with which to start the range.

params.name: options.endType
params.description: Either "open" or "closed". Use constants KeyRange::TYPE_OPEN and KeyRange::TYPE_CLOSED for guaranteed correctness.

methods.name: numeric
methods.description:
Create a Numeric object.

Numeric represents a value with a data type of Numeric.

It supports a fixed 38 decimal digits of precision and 9 decimal digits of scale, and values are in the range of -99999999999999999999999999999.999999999 to 99999999999999999999999999999.999999999.

params.name: value
params.description: The Numeric value.

methods.name: pgNumeric
methods.description:
Represents a value with a data type of PG Numeric for the Postgres Dialect database.

It supports a value precision of up to 131072 digits before the decimal point and up to 16383 digits after the decimal point.

params.name: value
params.description: The PgNumeric value.

methods.name: pgJsonb
methods.description: Represents a value with a data type of PG JSONB for the Postgres Dialect database.

methods.name: int64
methods.description: Create an Int64 object. This can be used to work with 64 bit integers as a string value while on a 32 bit platform.

params.name: seconds
params.description: The number of seconds in the duration.

params.name: nanos
params.description: The number of nanoseconds in the duration. Defaults to 0.

methods.name: commitTimestamp
methods.description:
Create a CommitTimestamp object.

Commit Timestamps may be used to implement server-side commit timestamp tracking in tables. Refer to Google\Cloud\Spanner\CommitTimestamp for usage details.
